section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Antilock Braking System prevents locking of the wheels during braking.
The vehicle maintains its steerability even during emergency braking, which increases the active driving safety.
The Antilock Braking System is ready after each time drive readiness is turned on.

section.title: Brake assistant
section.paragraph: The brake assistant applies maximum braking assistance when the brake is depressed quickly. It reduces the braking distance to a minimum during emergency braking. The advantages of the Antilock Braking System are thereby utilized.
Do not reduce the pressure on the brake pedal for the duration of emergency braking.

section.title: Adaptive brake assistant
section.paragraph: In combination with Cruise Control with Distance Control, this system ensures that the brakes respond even more rapidly with brake actuation in critical situations.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The drive-off assistant supports driving off on uphill grades.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Servotronic is a speed-dependent power steering function.
The system provides the steering force with more support at low speeds than at higher ones. This makes it easier to park, for instance, and makes steering firmer when driving at faster speeds.
Furthermore, the steering force adapts to the driving mode to convey a firm, sporty feel or a comfortable steering response.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Dynamic Stability Control helps to keep the vehicle on a steady course by reducing drive power and by brake interventions on individual wheels.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The system detects the following unstable driving conditions, for instance:

item.paragraph: Skidding, which can lead to oversteering.
Loss of adhesion of the front wheels, which can lead to understeering.

overview.overview-text: Also observe surrounding traffic and adapt driving style

warning.paragraph: The system cannot serve as a substitute for the driver’s personal judgment in assessing the traffic situation. Based on the limits of the system, it cannot independently react to all traffic situations. There is a risk of accident. Adjust driving style to traffic conditions. Watch the surrounding traffic situation closely, be ready to take over steering and braking at any time, and actively intervene where appropriate.

overview.overview-text: Do not deactivate the Dynamic Stability Control when driving with a roof load

warning.paragraph: When driving with a roof load, for instance with roof-mounted luggage rack, the vehicle's center of gravity is higher, which increases the risk of the vehicle tipping in critical driving situations. There may be a risk of accident or risk of damage to property. Drive with roof load only with activated Dynamic Stability Control.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Dynamic Traction Control is a variant of the Dynamic Stability Control where the drive power is optimized.
The system ensures maximum drive power on unusual road conditions, for instance unplowed snow covered roads or loose road surfaces, but with somewhat limited driving stability.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: When the Dynamic Traction Control is activated, there is maximum traction. Driving stability is limited during acceleration and when cornering.
A brief activation of the Dynamic Traction Control may be useful in the following situations:

item.paragraph: When driving in slush or on uncleared, snow-covered roads.
When driving off from deep snow or loose ground.
When driving with tire chains.

section.title: Principle

Because of the needs-based use of the all-wheel-drive system, Efficient4x4 yields a reduction in consumption.

section.title: M sport differential
section.paragraph: The active M differential provides for continuously variable locking of the rear axle differential depending on the driving situation. This prevents spinning of a single rear wheel and thereby provides optimal traction in any driving situation.
The driver is responsible adapting his or her driving style to the situation.

section.title: Active M differential
section.paragraph: The active M differential provides for continuously variable locking of the rear axle differential depending on the driving situation. This prevents an individual rear wheel from spinning even when the Dynamic Stability Control is turned off and in M Dynamic Mode, and thus enables optimum traction in all driving situations.
The driver is responsible adapting his or her driving style to the situation.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Servotronic is a speed-dependent steering support.
The system provides the steering force with more support at low speeds than at higher ones. This makes it easier to park, for instance, and makes steering firmer when driving at faster speeds.
Furthermore, the steering force adapts according to the driving mode, so that a firm, sporty feel or a comfortable steering response is conveyed.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: The Integral Active Steering increases the maneuverability of the vehicle and makes a more direct steering response possible.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The Integral Active Steering is a combination of the variable steering ratio of the front axle and the rear axle steering.
The rear axle steering acts to increase maneuverability at low speeds by turning the rear wheels slightly in the opposite direction to the front wheels.
At higher speeds, the rear wheels are turned in the same direction as the front wheels. For instance, this results in a harmonious lane change.

In critical driving situations, the Integral Active Steering can stabilize the vehicle through purposeful steering of the rear wheels before the driver intervenes, for instance in case of oversteering.

section.title: Setting
section.paragraph: The system offers several different settings.
With the driving modes of the My Modes, the system can be set to comfortable or dynamic.
Additional information:
My Modes.

section.title: Using tire chains
section.paragraph: In order to guarantee free movement of the wheels when operating with tire chains, rear axle steering must be turned off when tire chains are mounted.
Additional information:
Rear axle steering during operation with tire chains.

section.title: Malfunction
section.paragraph: A Check Control message is displayed.
In the event of a malfunction, the steering wheel must be turned further at lower speeds. The response of the vehicle is more sensitive in higher speed ranges.
There is no longer support of the Integral Active Steering in critical driving situations.
Proceed cautiously and drive defensively.
Have the system checked by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Variable sport steering
section.paragraph: The variable sport steering facilitates direct and agile handling with little steering effort. The variable sports steering works independently of the current speed, varying the steering ratio in line with the steering angle.
